intro: Oetosis piloselloides, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the dandelion family. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environments, including roadsides and meadows. Oetosis piloselloides is a perennial herb that is often considered a weed due to its ability to spread rapidly.
